comments.body: If you want you can add yourself to the authors list, but it's completely up to you
That seems more accurate yes, as Pose seems to be always converting to proper Vector3/Quaternion. So yes, I would suggest going with that change.
Should the default be `ServiceRequest` to match the old behavior?

The issue is that https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/55066/files#diff-726d2dc6f8cec1d3206d29c4e5f5207d9b7ca4e967c7295abca636e6976ddb1cL324 is typed as `any` rather than `ServiceRequest`. Defaulting the generic to `any` keeps it backwards compatible whereas doing `TServiceRequest = ServiceRequest` causes the tests to fail on line [87](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/725f962de94a26a880a34a0f6e0d277b7512e68a/types/roslib/roslib-tests.ts#L87):
```
ERROR: 87:20  expect  TypeScript@4.4 compile error: 
Property 'a' does not exist on type 'ServiceRequest'.
ERROR: 87:28  expect  TypeScript@4.4 compile error: 
Property 'b' does not exist on type 'ServiceRequest'.
```
You could try `TServiceRequest extends ServiceRequest = any` but it looks like `ServiceRequest` has no properties, so it doesn't really matter.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +284,288 @@
    export class Service <
        TServiceRequest = any,
        TServiceResponse = any
    > {
